newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Sara Lee rating cut.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Sara Lee rating cut.

text.p: Goldman Sachs analyst Nomi Ghez on Thursday cut her rating on food and consumer products company Sara Lee Corp to a market performer from market outperformer.

-- "...(W)e believe a second year of single digit operating income, combined with continuing hosiery difficulties are likely to put a lid on the stock's appreciation in the current market environment," Ghez said in a report. "We believe the downside risk in the stock is limited due to its year-to-date relative underperformance, and continuing active share buybacks."
-- Earlier, Sara Lee reported earnings for the fourth quarter of $0.57 a share, up from $0.52 a year ago.

-- Sara Lee said all of its four business units reported gains in operating profit. In Personal Products, however, worldwide legwear units fell seven percent during the quarter, reflecting a nine percent decline in sheer hosiery unit volume and a one percent increase in socks.

-- Ghez said the earnings were in line with her estimates, but added operating income for Sara Lee was up only by a single-digit percentage in the fourth quarter and fiscal 1997, largely due to the effects of foreign currencies.

-- The analyst said she maintained her fiscal 1998 earnings estimate at $2.25 a share but said she now expected these results to be achieved with lower than previously expected tax rate and operating income up only by a mid-single-digit rate.
-- Sarea Lee shares were off 1-2/16 at 43-9/16.
